column1: According to this AM's newspapers, Spain will be placed in the amber category from Monday 06/07/2020.In spanish: https://www.laverdad.es/internacional/espana…Or here (in spanish): https://elpais.com/sociedad/2020-06-27/el-re…Green: Austria, Barbados, Croatia, Germany, New Zealand, Greece, Thailand & Vietnam.Amber: Spain, Australia, Belgium, Canada, Denmark, France, Italy, Japan, the Netherlands, Singapore, South Korea & Switzerland.Red: United States of America, Brazil, Argentina, Chile, Colombia, Egypt, India, Israel, Mexico, Morocco, South Africa, Sweden, Russia...The UK Gov is supposed to formally anounce which countries will be in which groups next Tuesday 30/06/2020. So, the above groups are based on what the journalists have been 'briefed' on.Travellers from green and amber countries arriving in the UK from the effective date will not have to quarantine for 14 days.Apparently, PT will be placed in the red category due to the surge in SARS-CoV-2 infections in and around Lisbon. However, a UK Gov spokesperson admitted that once the ES-PT border is re-opened, there's nothing to stop anyone from travelling to and from an airport in Spain and crossing the ES-PT border for their holiday.

From the DofT this afternoon.This applies to ENGLAND only from 10 July 2020. The 59 countries in the self-isolation exemption list are in the link below:https://www.gov.uk/guidance/coronavirus-covi…No 'travel corridors', no 'traffic light system', just an exemption list. This exemption applies to all travel to ENGLAND, by train, ferry, coach, air, sea-horse, beamed down from the Starship Enterprise or any other route.The DofT says that they 'will keep the conditions in these countries and territories under review. If they worsen we will not hesitate to reintroduce self-isolation requirements.' So, best to check before you travel for updates.Did I mention that this applies to ENGLAND only?Cheers!
